resources.string:
This program processes a list of vertexes given in the form of a source and destination node numbers, starting at 0, describing a directed graph.

The output is a list of all elementary circuits of the graph given.

The algorithm is based on:
Johnson, D.B. (1975) Finding All the Elementary Circuits of a Directed Graph. SIAM Journal on Computing, 4, 77-84.
http://dx.doi.org/10.1137/0204007

Implementation was taken from:
https://github.com/josch/cycles_johnson_meyer

And forked as:
https://github.com/udif/cycles_johnson_meyer/tree/dev

Program Icon was taken from:
Graph icons created by SBTS2018 - Flaticon

How to use this program.

This is a small app I wrote to play around with some directed graph algorithms.

The main table can be created by adding rows using the ADD button.
When you add a row, please fill it with the source and destination nodes.
The sort button will sort the table.
The RANDOMIZE button will create a random graph on the existing table rows, with the number of nodes being approximately half the number of rows.

Pressing RUN will run the D.B. Johnson algorithm for Finding all the elementary circuits of a directed graph.
For more details on this algorithm, please consult the repositories as appearing in the About window

Why don\'t you add some rows first?
Let me suggest at least 4.
If you don\'t know how to fill the rows, just press the RANDOMIZE button.
Table data should only contain integers!
